entry.title: Is there any App like Manage Output Items for Billing Documents
entry.content:
In app Manage Output Items for Deliveries, I can search delivery output items with filters and then download their output documents through clicking Display in the column "Document".

Is there similar App like Manage Output Items for Billing Documents to do the same thing?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Tax code via price determination cannot be determined – Intercompany Settlement (CCS)
entry.content:
I am working on a configuration scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I am facing an issue with tax code determination during pricing. When creating the document, the system stops with the following error:

“Tax code via price determination cannot be determined, check Customizing.”

 

These are the configurations in the system (Intercompany between Germany and the US):

 

Procedure Royalties IC In (Germany)

Procedure Royalties IC Out (Germany)

Procedure Royalties IC In (US)

The Condition Type RITT has a reference cond. type TTX1

Set Tax Rates - Purchasing

Material Tax Data

Business Partner Output Tax details:

Any insights into why the tax code is not being determined in Public Cloud, or which specific configuration might be missing, would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: OUTSTANDING CAPITAL BALANCE TO BE AMORTIZED (FIXED ASSETS) WITHOUT ASSIGNMENT.
entry.content:
Good morning,

I am currently performing the accounting data uploads for our client and I'm encountering a problem when loading the Fixed Assets.

Once the master data and fixed asset postings have been uploaded, when I check the Balance Sheet, I see that the fixed assets, including both their acquisition and their depreciation, are correct. The problem is that the difference between the acquisition value and the amortized capital (net book value) is being taken below to "WITHOUT ASSIGNMENT" using a specific SAP account that is configured in the Account Determination, and it shows a negative value.

We need to know if this is correct, if we have the wrong account in the Account Determination, or if we would have to make a clearing entry after the upload to move that value to a specific part of the Balance Sheet.

I am attaching screenshots of how the balance sheet appears and the configuration of the Account Determination.

Thank you very much. Regards.

entry.title: Difference between PSM (Public Sector Management) and Standard SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear reader,

 

I was wondering why the functionalities in Manage Substitution / Validation Rules are so different from the "Standard" public cloud environment and the PSM (Public Sector Management). 

Is it purely licensing or is it a completely different technical framework?

 

Kind regards,

R

entry.title: The lease invoice is not created.
entry.content:
Hello colleagues.

I'm working with the scope item “Lease-Out Accounting (21Q)”. After creating and activating a contract, I run the periodic posting and try to create the invoice using the Fiori app “Schedule Invoice Creation - Background Job.” However, the process ends in error and does not generate the invoice.

It is important to mention that I'm following every step contained in the script published in Signavio for this scope item.

This is my contract:

These are the parameters I used for performing periodic accounting:

And this is the detail of the error thrown by the “Schedule Invoice Creation - Background Job” process:

Parameters:

Does anyone know what is causing this error?

Thanks,

Fernando.

entry.title: How To Set The PO Price Type Default Value
entry.content:
PO Price Type – Need Default as “NET PRICE”
In the PR, the field “PO Price Type” provides a dropdown (Net Price, Do Not Adopt, etc.).

Business Requirement:
The system should default the PO Price Type to “Net price.”

Expected Behavior:
The PO Price Type should default to “Net Price” during PR creation.
Actual Behavior:
The PO Price Type is not defaulting to the required value.
Steps to Reproduce:
Go to Create Purchase Requisition.
Check PO Price Type field → default value is incorrect.
Request:
Kindly investigate the configuration behind these two behaviors and provide the required corrections so that:
The PO Price Type defaults automatically to “Net Price.”


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Public Cloud - Debit/Credit Shift Between FSV Nodes - API or CDS view
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are currently working on a project in which the business intelligence functionality is handled in an external system. As part of this setup, we transfer financial data — such as assets and liabilities — to that system, and the Debit/Credit Shift Between FSV Nodes is activated.

However, for the accounts where this function is enabled, we do not receive any information indicating whether the journal entry was posted to an asset or liability account. We have not been able to retrieve this information through any available API or CDS view, nor have we found a way to automatically identify which accounts are flagged for the shift within the hierarchy.

We kindly request your support in identifying how this information can be retrieved.

Kind regards,
William

entry.title: Clicking “Components Missing” in Manage Production Orders returns to Home Page
entry.content:
Hello experts,

In Manage Production Orders (F2337), when I click the issue link “Components Missing → 200012842”, the system immediately redirects me back to the Fiori Launchpad home page instead of opening the component or missing parts details.

My questions:

  1. Why does the navigation fail and return to the homepage?

  2. Is the navigation target (such as Missing Parts or Component Details) restricted by app-to-app permissions?

  3. Which business role(s) should contain the required app for this navigation?

  4. Is this an issue specific to demo tenants (DE* systems), e.g., incomplete intent-based navigation configuration?

I would appreciate any clarification or guidance.
Thank you!

entry.title: Attachments in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello!

I have a question regarding attachments that I am struggling to find documentation for. When I upload an attachment to a business object in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (e.g. a PDF of a supplier invoice), where is this attachment stored from a technical perspective? Is there a repository directly within S/4HANA or does it use another service such as the SAP Document Management Service (DMS) on BTP?

What role does the Attachment Service play in this process?

Best regards,
Kaiwen

entry.title: Monitor External Requirements – “Too many data records selected” even with filters applied
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I’m facing an issue when using the Monitor External Requirements app in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Even though I have already applied multiple filters (Shortage Definition, MRP Controller, Plant, etc.), the app still throws the following message and does not display any result:

After confirming the message, the app shows “No data found”.

However, I’m certain that the returned data volume should be much smaller because I already provided restrictive filters — but the app still behaves as if no filter was applied at all.

My questions:

  1. Is this a known limitation of the Monitor External Requirements app?

  2. How can I ensure that the app does not return this error and properly fetches filtered data?

Attached screenshot for reference:

 

Thank you very much for your help!
Best regards.

entry.title: Serial Number Profile : Prefix (CBC activity 103636)
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to set up Serial number prefix for my customer.

I have read this blog which explains how to kind of manage serial numbers number range but this model can only work if we want to have the same number ranges for ALL materials in all divisions because the reange number is related to the equipment category. Also it will only accept digits, no alphanumerical characters, special character etc...

Instead, I thought about using the Prefix field in the CBC activity 103636 which really seems dedicated to that usage:

But whether it is numerical or alphanumerical characters, the prefix won't show on the material serial numbers automatically created.

Note : this is to work with WM.

Any idea what I am doing wrong to make it work?

Many thanks,

Adrien

entry.title: VOFM – Custom Routine for Packaging Instruction Determination in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, during packaging instruction determination for production receipts with synchronous posting, the system automatically determines the main packaging instruction. However, the alternative packaging instructions are not displayed.

In my case, the selection of an alternative instruction is based on the Production Version, but this field is not available in the field catalog for condition-based determination. In the configuration step Define Schema for Packaging Instruction Determination, there is a “Condition” field. In on-premise systems, this would be implemented using a condition formula created in transaction VOFM.

I have seen SAP Notes related to VOFM enablement in Cloud for sales pricing determination (for example, Note 2885513). I also checked the documentation here:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/e78cbf53f106b44ce10000000a174cb4.html?locale=en-US
but found nothing regarding packaging instruction determination.

My question is:
Is it possible to develop custom condition formulas for packaging instruction determination in SAP Public Cloud?
If yes, what is the correct approach?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Configuration ID 102742 missing in S4C 2508?
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts!

My customer wants to group their vendors by number, which is nothing new in S4C. I have always done this as follows:

1. Define Number Ranges (102296)

2. Define Groupings and Assign Number Ranges (102241)

 

When creating a business partner, I now get the message:

“Grouping ZK01 has not been assigned to a supplier account group.”

I also know the solution. There was always the configuration:

3. Define Number Assignment for Direction BP to Vendor (102742)

But that's no longer in CBC?!?!? What happened? And how do I configure my groupings and number ranges now?

Thanks in advance for any advice and best regards,

Rado

entry.title: Fixed Asset with Asset Subnumber migration not correct
entry.content:
Hi, 

please I need your advice in FA migration with SubAsset numbers in SAP Public into company code with already existing Fixed Assets

I am migrating FA for example 10000001-0 and 10000001-1 into company code where already exists asset 10000001-0 , however asset 10000001-1 does not exist in target.

I migrated master data of main asset and subasset in 1 template. Asset 10000001-0 was migrated to newly created asset 10000301-0. But subasset 10000001-1 was not added to 10000301-as subasset 1, but, it was created in target to asset 10000001-as subasset 1. 

Please, how to do correct migration of subasset to target 10000301? And then, how to add correctly the values?

entry.title: Preventing Negative Balances in Cost Centers in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear community,

I’m working in SAP Public Cloud environments and, while configuring and reviewing cost centers, I’ve noticed that they can end up showing a negative balance.

Based on the operational setup we’re implementing, this shouldn’t happen. My question is:

Is there any way in the system to trigger an error, a warning, or some kind of alert when a cost center is about to go negative?

I’d appreciate any guidance, experience, or configuration tips that could help control this behavior.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Budget Availability Control for Project
entry.content:
Good afternoon, I am trying to configure budget control for a project in SAP Public Cloud.

Once I added the accounts I want to belong to the budget group to the YPS2 hierarchy and ran some tests, I noticed that if I posted an account that was not in that group, the system allowed me to post it, although obviously it did not deduct it from the budget.

For cost centers, I managed to solve this problem by setting up a group of accounts and adding all the accounts that did not belong to the control to it, so that when I posted, an error message appeared saying that there was no budget in that group.

For projects, I thought of the same solution, creating a semantic tag and setting it up in the profile, but when creating it, SAP only allows one semantic tag per profile.

Having explained my doubt, my question is clear: is there any way to do something similar to what I did in the cost center budgeting for projects?

Since I have seen that it is not possible through parameterization...

I am attaching images to provide more context.

Best regards

entry.title: Sales withholding tax differences between SD/FI document
entry.content:
I've configured everything to calculate self-withholding tax from the SD module. The system correctly calculates the self-withholding tax in the SD document based on the net invoice value. However, when the invoice is posted to the FI document, it's calculating a different value. In this case, I created the indicator ZWC1-Z_Autoreten CO with 1.2%, the net invoice value is COP $2,600,000, and the condition value is COP $31,200. Meanwhile, in FI, the accounting entry is for $65,000 COP.

Invoice document:

Post Document:

Configuration

ZWC1 Condition

Define Withholding tax for sales

Define Withholding tax

Assign conditions type to Withholding tax

BP

Thanks for your help,

Adrián Ramírez.
